contentencoded:
“New Yorker” film critic David Denby becomes transfixed by movies, and loves to walk out of the theater, eyes glazed, with his fellow film-goers. And, for that reason, he thinks the movies still matter in this era of multi-platform entertainment.


That does not mean, however, that he loves everything Hollywood is putting out.  Listen to the full interview from when he joined us to talk about the state of American cinematic affairs.
